tags.scope: Coder agent orchestration, planning, and execution
tags.comment: Use for aspects describing the internal agent service, task pipelines, and tool coordination logic.

tags.scope: High-level application architecture and runtime boundaries
tags.comment: Capture system structure, major components, lifecycles, and cross-cutting concerns.

tags.scope: CI, CD, scheduled jobs, and developer automation
tags.comment: Apply to build pipelines, workflows, Taskfile recipes, and bot automation.

tags.scope: Bubble Tea TUI framework usage
tags.comment: Use when an aspect explains Bubble Tea programs, models, views, or command wiring.

tags.scope: Chat page UI behaviours and messaging overlays
tags.comment: Use for aspects covering chat thread layout, message rendering, sidebar state, and related TUI chat interactions.

tags.scope: Command-line interface, Cobra commands, and flags
tags.comment: Attach to aspects covering CLI entrypoints, command behaviours, and flag handling.

tags.scope: Runtime orchestration commands exposed via the CLI
tags.comment: Use for CLI commands that bootstrap Crush, manage runtime data directories, refresh providers, or surface runtime logs.

tags.scope: Reusable TUI component primitives and base utilities
tags.comment: Apply to aspects covering foundational TUI components (lists, keymaps, status widgets) that other views embed.

tags.scope: Thread-safe collections, synchronization, and parallel primitives
tags.comment: Use when documenting csync maps, slices, lazy loaders, or other concurrency-oriented helpers.

tags.scope: Configuration files, schema, environment resolution
tags.comment: Use for configuration loading, defaults, schema generation, and option handling.

tags.scope: Data persistence layer and SQL contracts
tags.comment: Apply to migrations, sqlc queries, database services, and transactional flows.

tags.scope: Modal dialogs and overlay UX flows
tags.comment: Use for aspects detailing dialog stacks, keymaps, and modal workflows presented in the TUI.

tags.scope: Diff generation and presentation utilities
tags.comment: Attach to aspects describing diff computation, formatting, and where diff output is consumed in tools or the TUI.

tags.scope: Release engineering and packaging
tags.comment: Use for GoReleaser, packaging metadata, and distribution logic.

tags.scope: Environment variable resolution and overrides
tags.comment: Use when aspects describe env var resolvers, CRUSH_* shadowing, or provider credential lookup.

tags.scope: Event tracking and analytics
tags.comment: Use when describing metric events, telemetry pipelines, or feature tracking logic.

tags.scope: Filesystem layout, directories, and file operations
tags.comment: Apply to aspects covering path resolution, directory scaffolding, or file traversal utilities.

tags.scope: Conversation history, files, and summaries
tags.comment: Apply to aspects covering stored messages, file revisions, and summarization flows.

tags.scope: LLM integration and provider abstractions
tags.comment: Use for provider clients, streaming, prompts, and tool-call handling.

tags.scope: Language Server Protocol clients and wiring
tags.comment: Attach to aspects describing LSP client lifecycle, configuration, and synchronization.

tags.scope: Model Context Protocol integrations
tags.comment: Use for MCP tool configuration, process management, and HTTP/SSE bridges.

tags.scope: Logging, metrics, profiling, and diagnostics
tags.comment: Apply to slog configuration, metrics toggles, profiling hooks, and debug tooling.

tags.scope: First-run setup, onboarding screens, and initialization workflows
tags.comment: Use for aspects detailing Crush onboarding, initialization markers, or guided setup flows.

tags.scope: Permission prompts and tool approvals
tags.comment: Use when documenting permission service behaviours, auto-approval modes, and policy enforcement.

tags.scope: LLM prompt templates and orchestration
tags.comment: Apply to aspects explaining embedded prompt files, context builders, and template selection logic for agents.

tags.scope: External model provider clients and adapters
tags.comment: Use for aspects covering provider-specific client construction, authentication, and event conversion logic.

tags.scope: Publish/subscribe brokers inside the app
tags.comment: Attach to aspects detailing pubsub brokers, subscription flows, and fan-out messaging.

tags.scope: Text rendering and formatting in the terminal UI
tags.comment: Use for aspects that escape, format, or position content within Crush's TUI components.

tags.scope: JSON schema and validation
tags.comment: Use for schema generation, structure, and compatibility guarantees.

tags.scope: Session lifecycle and management
tags.comment: Apply when covering session creation, updates, summarization, and related workflows.

tags.scope: Shell execution and sandboxed command runners
tags.comment: Attach to aspects covering Crush's shell executor, persistent shells, and command blocking policies.

tags.scope: SQLite usage and tuning
tags.comment: Use for database connection setup, pragmas, and filesystem placement.

tags.scope: Theming primitives, palettes, and shared styling helpers
tags.comment: Apply to aspects describing theme construction, icon glyph sets, markdown/chroma style exports, and other reusable TUI styling utilities.

tags.scope: Automated regression, snapshot, and integration coverage
tags.comment: Use for aspects documenting test suites, fixtures, and golden regressions across the project.

tags.scope: Terminal UI layout, panes, and UX
tags.comment: Attach to aspects describing views, components, focus, and rendering behaviours.

tags.scope: Composite TUI widgets and experimental UI modules
tags.comment: Use for aspects describing higher-level list, diff, or other interactive widgets that assemble smaller components.
